treatment.reference: Methanosarcina thermophila sp. nov. a Thermophilic, Acetotrophic, Methane-Producing Bacterium IJSB 35:522-523
treatment.description: Cells are gram positive and spherical and appear as irregular aggregates which are often more than 100 µm across and which appear refractile when viewed by phase-contrast microscopy. Colonies in agar are 1 to 3 mm in diameter and yellow and have a rough granular consistency. Growth occurs on acetate, methanol, or methylated amines and may occur slowly on H2-CO2. The optimum growth temperature is near 50˚C, and the optimum pH is between 6.0 and 7.0. The only described strain requires para-aminobenzoic acid for growth. The DNA base composition of this strain is 42 mol% guanine plus cytosine. Source: 55°C anaerobic sludge digestor. Type strain: strain TM-1 (= DSM 1825).
